data.name: Thread Bomb
data.description:
# Meanwhile, in JVM Land...

Once again, the UCLF (URLClassLoader Forces) have deployed you, the preeminent bomb specialist, to sweep a recently-captured area. You and your squad methodically pick your way through the remains of what was once a magnificent and elephantine non-blocking queue implementation when Frank, your right-hand man, once again detects that all-too-familiar ticking noise -- you'd think the bomb manufacturers would have learned by now to not include surround-sound speakers!

This bomb seems to use a off-thread arming mechanism: the main detonation thread spawns a second thread that arms the bomb by setting an entry in a `boolean[]`. Furthermore, this seems to occur under mutual exclusion via the monitor of the very same `boolean[]` instance, so the bomb will always be armed if run normally. Fortunately, you think you might be able to prevent it from running normally -- after all, you and your squad's lives depend on it.

You use your trusty bytecode injector to inject your `void defuse()` method, and the game begins...
